pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.1.10: That is, the last month of the rainy season, plus the four months of the cold season.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.1.12: According to the commentary, [](Sp.4.813.4), “Whoever does any work to be done in regard to the robe—the Mahāpaccariya says, ‘Even one who just threads the needle’—may eat a group meal because he is making a robe,” _yo tattha cīvare kattabbaṃ yaṃkiñci kammaṃ karoti, mahāpaccariyañhi “antamaso sūcivedhanako”tipi vuttaṃ, tena cīvarakārasamayoti bhuñjitabbaṃ_.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.1.15: Half a _yojana_. The length of a _yojana_ is uncertain, and perhaps it never was a precise distance. But a reasonable estimate is 8 miles or just under 13 kilometers (see ACMC, p.16). Thus half a _yojana_ is just over 6 km.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.3.7: One of the sub-commentaries says: _Ekasmiṃ pakkhe ekadivasaṃ dātabbaṃ bhattaṃ pakkhikaṃ_, “_pakkhikaṃ_ means: meal to be given one day in one half-month.” (Sp-ṭ.2.30).
